intro: Alsine tenuifolia proles arvatica, commonly known as slender alsike grass, is a flowering plant native to North America. It belongs to the family Caryophyllaceae and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, white or pinkish flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, disturbed soils and is often found in meadows, wetlands, and along stream banks. It has narrow, linear leaves and produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds. This species is adapted to wet environments and plays a role in stabilizing soil in riparian areas.
